title: Prework Study Guide
description: This study guide's purpose was created in order to have a centralized location for notes on the basics of HTML, CSS, Git, and JavaScript, and to get basic experience in the web development process.

title: HoriSEOn Website Refactor
description: The week 01 bootcamp challenge was to refactor the HTML and CSS code for the Horiseon company web page. The original code used non-semantic HTML and the CSS had a lot of redundant code that needed to be removed. The overall look of the site remained the same after all of the changes were made but the underlying code was more semantic and efficient.

title: My Portfolio
description: The week 02 bootcamp challenge was to create a website from scratch with various acceptance criteria that included things like a responsive layout, images of previous projects, a profile pic of yourself, a way to contact you, etc.

title: Password Generator
description: The week 03 bootcamp challenge was to create a password generator using JavaScript with the following requirements: Use prompts and confirms for the user to be able to generate a random password with a length of 8 to 128 characters, with the user choosing what type of characters should be in the password (i.e. uppercase, lowercase, numbers, special characters, etc.).

title: Coding Quiz
description: The week 04 challenge was to create a multiple choice JavaScript quiz that was timed, scored, and kept track of your scores, along with your initials you have to enter, by storing them in the local storage of the browser.

title: Workday Scheduler
description: The week 05 challenge was to create a daily scheduler that was dynamically generated by the user and has features such as the current date, hour blocks that are color coded to indicate if they are past/present/future, and the ability to enter events that will persist in the local storage of the browser.

title: Weather Dashboard
description: The week 06 challenge was to create a weather dashboard that was dynamically generated by the user and has features such as the current date, a 5 day forecast, and the ability to enter a city name and have the weather data for that city displayed.

title: Project 1: Loot Vault
description: A website for gamers on a budget! With a responsive design and easy to use navigation, you can find any game you want at the best prices!

title: Readme Generator
description: The week 09 challenge was to create a README generator using NodeJS with the following requirements: Use the Inquirer package to prompt the user for information about their project and then generate a README file based off of the user's input.

title: SVG Logo Maker
description: The week 10 challenge was to create an SVG logo maker using NodeJS with the inquirer package and the Jest Testing framework for unit tests. The application prompts the user for the shape, color, and text the logo should be made of and then generates an SVG logo based off of the user's input.

title: ExpressJS Note Taker
description: The week 11 challenge was to create a note taking application using Express.js for the back end and connecting it to an already created front-end.

title: MySQL Employee Tracker
description: The week 12 challenge was to create a command line application that allows the user to view and manage the departments, roles, and employees in a company. The application uses NodeJS, the Inquirer package, and the MySQL package to connect to a MySQL database and perform CRUD operations on the database.

title: ORM Ecommerce Backend
description: The week 13 challenge was to create a back end for an e-commerce site using express.js and sequelize to interact with a MySQL database and demonstrate the functionality of the application using Insomnia Core.

title: MVC Tech Blog
description: The week 14 challenge was to create a tech blog using the MVC paradigm.

title: Project 2: Task Titan
description: A website where you can create, track, edit, delete, and complete tasks. Use Task Titan to CRUSH your tasks to build awesome projects!

title: URL Regex Tutorial
description: A GitHub gist that explains how to use regular expressions to validate URLs.

title: NoSQL Social Network API
description: The week 18 challenge was to create a back end for a social networking API using express.js and Mongoose to interact with a MongoDB database and demonstrate the functionality of the application using Insomnia.

title: PWA Text Editor
description: The week 19 challenge was to create a Progressive Web App (PWA) text editor that uses IndexedDB to store the user's notes and Webpack to bundle the application.

title: My React Portfolio
description: The week 20 challenge was to create a portfolio using React. It is a single page application that uses React Router to navigate between pages, uses Tailwind CSS for the styling, and was created using Vite instead of Create React App.

title: Project 3: WedLoc
description: WedLoc is not just another wedding platform; it's a one-of-a-kind social hub designed exclusively for wedding photographers and videographers. Our mission is to provide a seamless space for professionals to organize and showcase wedding media, making it easy for couples and guests to relive their special moments. With added features like media comments and real-time chat, we've eliminated the need for attendees to sign up, making the entire experience hassle-free.
